titles.title: Arizona Wilderness Land Title Resolution Act of 1993
Arizona Wilderness Land Title Resolution Act of 1994
Arizona Wilderness Land Title Resolution Act of 1994
Arizona Wilderness Land Title Resolution Act of 1994
A bill to resolve the status of certain lands in Arizona that are subject to a claim as a grant of public lands for railroad purposes, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S8823-8825)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

vote.text: Passed Senate with amendments by Voice Vote.

Received in the House.
Held at the desk.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 103-773, Part I.
Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 103-773, Part II.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 421.

action.text: Mr. Brooks moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Rohrabacher objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.
Considered as unfinished business.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by recorded vote (2/3 required): 381 - 15 (Roll no. 459).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

bill.summary: 6/24/1994--Passed Senate amended. Arizona Wilderness Land Title Resolution Act of 1994 - Requires the Secretary of the Treasury to pay a specified sum, without interest, to Perrin Properties, Inc., upon being notified by the Attorney General that the appellants in Santa Fe Pacific Railroad Company et al. v. Secretary of the Interior have executed all documents necessary to: (1) dismiss with prejudice all litigation involving the title to certain lands in the Prescott National Forest, Arizona; and (2) release and quitclaim to the United States all right, title, and interest of the appellants and of Perrin Properties, Inc., in and to such lands. Requires the lands to be managed in accordance with the laws, rules, and regulations pertaining to the National Forest System and in accordance with the Wilderness Act if the lands lie within the boundaries of a wilderness area.
